page.title: 04A MENDIP ARABLE FARM 1
page.content: Priddy Hill Farm is in the north_east corner of the survey block. The farm covers an area of 450 acres,of which 400 acres are used for growing wheat, barley,rape,peas and oats. The remaining 50 acres are woodland, scrubland and a few acres of grass keep which are let. Arable farming is favoured by gently{undulating ground} and large fields; one field is in excess of 50 acres. The straw resulting from harvesting is auctioned off before harvesting actually occurs and the farmer only burns the stubble if weather conditions are favourable. Some of the grain is transported to Avonmouth and Southampton but the farmer has recently built his own storage facilities at the farm;peas are sold for the production of cattle food at Yeovel.
